posts.post_content: I love how the effect of this card lasts only until end of turn. So, all we need is [a creature with a toughness of six](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=234429): it can not only survive being DISMEMBERED, but wake up totally fine the next day! No arms? No legs? No problem!

posts.post_content: Comparable to [Snuff Out](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Snuff Out). Both cards could cost you 4 life. Snuff Out requires a swamp and no mana and Dismember costs no swamp but one mana, or two mana and two life, etc. Idk which is better but I personally prefer this card because hard casting it is a bit easier than hard casting snuff out.
posts.html:
Comparable to Snuff Out. Both cards could cost you 4 life. Snuff Out requires a swamp and no mana and Dismember costs no swamp but one mana, or two mana and two life, etc. Idk which is better but I personally prefer this card because hard casting it is a bit easier than hard casting snuff out.

Posted By: Crag-Hack (7/4/2011 3:32:22 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: One of the best removal spells ever printed, even in my White/Green midrange deck I always packed at least 3 in the sideboard, sometimes a few mainboard. Especially potent against Infect, as you won't care much about your life total when your opponent isn't gunning for it. Helps if you have some reliable life gain threats like [Baneslayer Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Baneslayer Angel) and [Sword of War and Peace](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sword of War and Peace) to offset the life loss, but if you can win fast enough, it shouldn't even matter.
posts.html:
One of the best removal spells ever printed, even in my White/Green midrange deck I always packed at least 3 in the sideboard, sometimes a few mainboard. Especially potent against Infect, as you won't care much about your life total when your opponent isn't gunning for it. Helps if you have some reliable life gain threats like Baneslayer Angel and Sword of War and Peace to offset the life loss, but if you can win fast enough, it shouldn't even matter.
